meanings.definition: A form of strabismus where one or both eyes turn outward.
meanings.sent1: Exotropia can cause one eye to look away from the other.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient with exotropia after noticing the outward turn of the eyes.
meanings.sent3: During the game of hide-and-seek, exotropia made it hard for Timmy to focus on finding his friends.
meanings.sent4: Her exotropia was like a compass pointing in the wrong direction, always leading her gaze astray.
meanings.sent5: The exotropia in her eyes created a striking image, as if they were trying to escape in opposite directions.

meanings.definition: A condition where the eyes are misaligned, causing one eye to deviate outward.
meanings.sent1: The optometrist explained that exotropia is when one eye turns outward due to misalignment.
meanings.sent2: Exotropia can affect a person's depth perception and ability to focus both eyes together.
meanings.sent3: The exotropia in his eyes played a prank on him, making him see double when trying to read.
meanings.sent4: Her exotropia was like a rebellious eye, always wanting to wander off on its own path.
meanings.sent5: The exotropia in the child's eyes was noticeable, giving him a unique and endearing look.
